  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to allow only certain users/groups to manage add-ons. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a separate permission to managing add-ons
fields.summary: Create a separate permission to managing add-ons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60609].
  {panel}

Consider the scenario:
Project Member Role - group A+group B
Project Administrators Role - group B

If user John is in group A and group A has global Bulk Change permission and group A is in Project Member Role for projects P1, P2, P3 with Edit Issue Project Permission in each of these then John would be able to Bulk Edit issues in all 3 projects (P1,P2,P3). 

 We want to:
1. John to be able Edit issues in P1, P2, P3
2. John to be able to Bulk Change issues in P1, P2
3. John to be denied Bulk Change issues in P3
4. Only Project Administrators who belong to group B must be able to Bulk Change issues in P3. Note John is not a member of the Project Administrators Role but group B is in both Project Member Role & Project Administrators Role for P3

If the Bulk Change was available per project under Project P3 Permission Scheme I would:
1, Grant Edit Issues to Project Members
2. Grant Bulk Change to Project Administrators
fields.summary: Grant Bulk Change permissions per project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60608].
  {panel}

As a user, I have a hard time keeping track of the emails I get from JIRA, and staying on top of comments out Test Analyst make or even just figure out with others complete sub-tasks.

I would like something similar to what YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and every other type of social website provides in notifications.

As a user I would like to:
1) See a notification icon next to my user's avatar
2) When I click the icon I see a list of notifications and their associated JIRA
3) I would like to only see notifications for tasks and subtasks: that I reported, I am assigned to, or JIRAs that I am watching.
4) I would like to see notifications for: new comments that have been made, files that have been uploaded, reassignment of the JIRA, etc.

Having this small little list would be so helpful in staying in touch with others through JIRA rather than my email client. 

Sincerely,
Chad Baldwin
fields.summary: Notifications Icon/List

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60607].
  {panel}

As a JIRA administrator, I'd like users to be able to disable (and re-enable) notifications from any desired combinations of events&projects, configurable on User Profiles, so that the Notification Scheme set on a project can satisfy multiple different needs without having to create a new Project Role for every combination of desired notifications.

!preferences.png!

Hovering the mouse cursor over the column header icon would show a tooltip with the notification's name.

Inline edit should allow changing fast the option in the cells.

Notification Schemes should limit the selectable enabled values.

This feature would only allow to receive less notifications than those set in the project's Notification Scheme.

This feature would be specially useful for notifications based on Issue Roles (reporter, assignee, watcher), as they cannot be further configurable to match different user preferences within the same project.
fields.summary: User Preference: Disable specified notification(s) from selected project(s)

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a mail handler with the option _CC Watchers_ being set to _true_.
* Mail a message cc'ing some users.
* Ensure that cc'ed users are actually watcing newly created issue.
  Also, using Notification Helper, make sure cc'ed users are the one who receive notifications for _Issue Created_ event.
* {{grep}} MTA logs for this issue.
  
h3. Expected Results

Everybody listed in notification scheme should appear in the log.

h3. Actual Results

Everybody _but_ the watchers are actually receiving notifications for this particular event.
However, watchers matched by any other notification scheme entry (i.e. role actors etc.) are not affected by this bug.

h3. Additional information

Simply look at the end of {{com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateIssueHandler.handleMessage}}: {{addCcWatchersToIssue}} is actually called (via the {{addCcWatchersAndAttachments}}) after {{context.createIssue}}. This should probably be handled differently, perhaps with a separate option, as users who usually switch 'notify on my own changes' toggle to 'off' would probably like to not have notifications described here in their inboxes as well.
fields.summary: cc'ed users are not receiving notifications upon issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Current JIRA docs regarding Oracle at [Connecting JIRA applications to Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/connecting-jira-applications-to-oracle-749382642.html] advised to use *AL32UTF8* character encoding:

bq. Ensure your database is configured to use the same character encoding as JIRA. The recommended encoding is AL32UTF8 (the Oracle equivalent of Unicode UTF-8).

Meanwhile JIRA does the health-check and uses *BINARY* Collation, see 
[Health Check: Database Collation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Health+Check%3A+Database+Collation], section _Supported Collations_

This Collation vs Character encoding is confusing. Please align docs and current JIRA recommendation. 
Oracle character encoding: https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/NLSPG/ch2charset.htm#NLSPG171
Oracle Collation: http://docs.oracle.com/database/121/NLSPG/ch5lingsort.htm#NLSPG1017
fields.summary: Documentation request: align Oracle docs with heath-check status

h3. Summary

JIRA 7 is shipped with Oracle JDBC driver 12.1.0.1.0: {{ojdbc7-12.1.0.1.jar}}
 Oracle Driver 12.1.0.1 throws error _Protocol violation_ during connection to Database.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.x
 * Database Oracle 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.1.0 or 12.1.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup JIRA and connect it to DB
 # Add some data (we don't have this specific set of data)
 # Run reindex

h3. Expected Results

It works fine.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the jira.log file:
{noformat}
2016-04-13 21:37:52,114 JiraTaskExectionThread-4 ERROR jiraadmins 1271x19429x1 1lemfi1 10.98.60.21 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All FAILED.  Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/jiraindex/infra711/jiraindex/caches/indexes/comments, /jiraindex/infra711/jiraindex/caches/indexes/issues, /jiraindex/infra711/jiraindex/caches/indexes/changes, /jiraindex/infra711/jiraindex/caches/indexes/worklogs, /jiraindex/infra711/jiraindex/caches/indexes/plugins/atlassian-subversion-revisions]
org.ofbiz.core.util.GeneralRuntimeException: Error getting the next result (Protocol violation: [ 46, ])
    at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityListIterator.next(EntityListIterator.java:251)
    at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizListIterator.next(DefaultOfBizListIterator.java:100)
    at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizListIterator.next(WrappingOfBizListIterator.java:68)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.DatabaseIssuesIterator.pullNextIssue(DatabaseIssuesIterator.java:97)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.DatabaseIssuesIterator.populateNextIssueIfNull(DatabaseIssuesIterator.java:68)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.DatabaseIssuesIterator.hasNext(DatabaseIssuesIterator.java:51)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.DatabaseIssuesIterable.foreach(DatabaseIssuesIterable.java:55)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.perform(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:282)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.indexIssuesBatchMode(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:151)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doIndexIssuesInBatchMode(DefaultIndexManager.java:984)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doStopTheWorldReindex(DefaultIndexManager.java:961)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.lambda$reIndexAll$0(DefaultIndexManager.java:326)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:359)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:326)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:258)
...
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Protocol violation: [ 46, ]
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:669)
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:249)
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:566)
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:215)
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.fetch(T4CPreparedStatement.java:1022)
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.fetchMoreRows(InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.java:1008)
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.absoluteInternal(InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.java:972)
    at oracle.jdbc.driver.InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.next(InsensitiveScrollableResultSet.java:572)
    at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingResultSet.next(DelegatingResultSet.java:191)
    at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingResultSet.next(DelegatingResultSet.java:191)
    at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityListIterator.next(EntityListIterator.java:245)
    ... 33 more

{noformat}
h3. Notes

May be related to Oracle Clob bug. See:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/java-sql-sqlexception-protocol-violation-caught-while-accessing-a-page-and-oracle-db-is-used-781393258.html]
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=780863295]
 * [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22785120/oracle-clob-reader-issue-protocol-violation]
 * [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4685021/sqlexception-protocol-violation-oracle-jdbc-driver-issue/35343994#35343994]

Conflicts with:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60007
h3. Workaround
 * Update Oracle driver from *12.1.0.1* to *12.2.0.1* version.
 ** Download *12.2.0.1* from here [Oracle JDBC 12.2.0.1 Driver|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/features/jdbc/jdbc-ucp-122-3110062.html].
 ** Stop JIRA
 ** Delete current driver {{ojdbc7-12.1.0.1.jar}} from [<JIRA-INSTALL>|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-installation-directory-189891102.html]/lib/ folder
 ** Upload new driver to <JIRA_INSTALL>/lib/ folder
 ** Start JIRA again
 * Using 12.2.0.1 will allow you to work around -JRA-61007- which our previous instructions (upgrading to 12.1.0.2) would cause.
fields.summary: Jira throws protocol violation error when reindexing due to outdated Oracle driver

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60603].
  {panel}

Hello,

When using the recently created chart gadget in Jira and setting it to weekly mode, the weeks always start on Sunday, even though ISO 8601 date format is enabled in the settings. (This can be seen when clicking on a weekly bar and the filter returned in Jira will show the start date, which is a Sunday).

Instead, the weeks should correctly start on Monday.

Would be great if this could be fixed :)
fields.summary: Recently Created Chart gadget weeks always start with Sunday

fields.description:
When no components are defined for the project, the field should not be shown on the create screen, even though it is part of the screen and field configuration. It is the same for the version field. As it is now the fields are shown as Component: None, when no options are defined.

The reason is a have multi projects using the same screens and field configurations, but only som of them use components and/or versions. So instead of having to create field configurations and/or screens for all the projects, this is much smarter. Additionally, this makes it possible for the project admins to decide whether or not they wish to use the fields, instead of a global admin. 

In addition, this is actually the way security levels work. Even though it is represented on the screen and shown on the field configuration, it is only visible for project where an issue security scheme has been set up. This behaviour is really nice, as only some projects need security levels.
fields.summary: Hide component/version when not in use

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to add a group with special characters in the name to the application access page, the below error is thrown on the page:
!Screen Shot 2016-04-13 at 5.56.09 PM.png|thumbnail!

 Refreshing the page takes you to the same page with the same error. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group with the name {{#IT}}
# Navigate to the Application Access Page 
# Select the group {{#IT}} and it to any application

h3. Expected Results
The group is added to the corresponding application

h3. Actual Results

An error pops up on the screen with the message {{This page it out of date. Your requested change cannot be completed. Please refresh the page and try again.}} Application Accesss can no longer be modified.

A HAR file will also reveal a 400 Bad Request with the URL missing the groupname:
{{http://localhost:8080/test/rest/api/2/group?groupname=&_=1460586754284 }}
 
h3.Workaround
The current workaround is to remove the offending group from the license role

*To simply get information about the application Roles using the [REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/]:*
# Log into JIRA 
# Access: {{<BASE-URL>/rest/api/2/applicationrole}}, which will return a JSON Response with details of the JIRA Application Users. 

*To Add or Remove a Group to a License Role*
# Use a REST Client to call the following as per [the REST API - Update Application Role|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/applicationrole-get]: 
{noformat}
<base-url>/rest/api/2/applicationrole/{key}
{noformat}
fields.summary: Adding a group with a name that contains special characters to application access throws an error

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60591].
  {panel}

If, for a given status: 
jira.permission.create.user = denied 

A test/issue in this status cannot be cloned.

This is problematic when for example, a test case (via Zephyr) needs to be locked down in a certain status. To enable editing of such a test case, it must be cloned. However, unless transitions are allowed/performed to a status that permits cloning, this is not feasible.

Ideally, one would like to be able to clone a test case that has been locked down from edits either because it is in its final approved form or has been executed. This is important for the system to be compliant from a QA perspective.
fields.summary: Cloning does not work on issues in locked statuses

h3. *Issue Summary*

When an issue is cloned, it would be great to have the watcher field cloned as well as this would prevent us having to add them in one at a time after it has been cloned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new issue.
* Add an extra user to the watcher list.
* Clone the issue.

h3. Expected behavior
All users in watcher list are still present in the cloned issue.

h3. Actual behavior
Only the Assignee and reporter are seen in the watcher list of cloned issue.
fields.summary: Clone Watcher Field JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60573].
  {panel}

When we first registered users in our JIRA Cloud instance, we registered everyone in the format <firstname>.<lastname>. As our user base grew, we decided to change everyones' user login to their email address, as we could guarantee that it was unique.

This has already caused a problem in JIRA Portfolio (see JPO-1381). I believe that it has also caused an issue with the Components functionality of JIRA, which is described below.

Steps to reproduce on our Cloud instance:

# Navigate to Components section of a Project (see !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.44.02.png|thumbnail!)
# Click on Actions > Edit against any of the listed components
# Dialog box is displayed (see  !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.59.53.png|thumbnail! ) - note that the Component Lead is listed as raj.mehta (which is the way we previously had users registered in our instance)
# I tried to change myself to Component Lead. JIRA correctly found me in the instance ( !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.52.17.png|thumbnail! ) and when I clicked save the following error occurred "The user gary.bates@phe.gov.uk does not exist" (see screenshot  !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.52.29.png|thumbnail! )

However, I definitely exist in the instance with that email address! And you can see that JIRA has found my profile picture against my name too.

I believe this is highly likely to be a similar issue to JPO-1381 (the fact we have changed our user logins across our instance from <firstname>.<lastname> to email address).
fields.summary: Unable to edit components after previously changing all users' user logins from the format <firstname>.<lastname> to their email address

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As of JIRA 7.1, JIRA needs to be able to communicate with itself in order to download resources from itself. 

This is not currently documented in: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/jira-applications-installation-requirements-802592164.html or any other locations. 

For a relevant background on this please see: [How to fix gadget titles showing as __MSG_gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget]

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide clear instructions that JIRA needs to be able to communicate with itself through JIRA's BASE URL. 
 
h3. Workaround
Use the Knowledge Base Article linked for technical details relating to this problem.
fields.summary: Document JIRA's requirement to be able to communicate with itself with it's base URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading to JIRA 7 it is noted that when creating a new user that the browser now fills in the currently saved username and password for the actual browser user.  In jira 6.x this did not occur.

h3. Environment
NA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA as admin go to user management and click create new user
# Note that if you have your current credentials saved in your browser that they now populate the username/password fields on the create user page
Create user in 7.x
 !7create.png|thumbnail! 
Create user in 6.x
 !6_create.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
Username/password on this create user screen should remain blank as they did in 6.x
h3. Actual Results
There is no error in the logs
 
h3. Notes
In 6.x it appears we had a pop up screen for new user creation and this did not trigger the browser to think it should populate the username/password whereas in 7.x we are redirecting to a new page and the browser is auto filling these lines incorrectly.

h3.Workaround
(If there is no workaround directly say so)
fields.summary: Username and password autofills on Create New user

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60567].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*

Currently in JIRA, when a user performs customization to their JIRA instance, they are forced to make copy their customization out of JIRA, perform the upgrade and only then perform the upgrade back.

This is especially true for user who make changes to their databases based on our knowledge base articles [such as this one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/ora-01461-can-bind-a-long-value-only-for-insert-into-a-long-column-error-due-to-oracle-database-definition-191500952.html].

In these a migration of serve seems the best solution as they can prepare the server before import however this would not be needed if JIRA upgrade process respects their customization.

*Expected behavior*
Either the upgrade process respects customer's customization or it allows them apply the required customization while upgrading.
fields.summary: JIRA Upgrade should maintain customization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60562].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 7.1 when accessing the Dashboard, JIRA gadgets use themselves as proxy, with the fully resolvable host name - so the JIRA instance needs to be able to access itself. If it's not able to do so (for example basic auth on a proxy layer, the domain name is not resolvable, it's served on an IP that's in a separate restricted subnet to the server JIRA is running on or JIRA is served with a self-signed certificate that doesn't exist in its own trust store) this error will occur.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement healthcheck in JIRA which will connect to BaseURL, mimicking call which will be done for gadgets. This will help in troubleshooting the problem. 

h3. Workaround 
Use curl command from JIRA server:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -v '<JIRA_URL>'
{code}

h3. Notes
See [How to fix gadget titles showing as __MSG_gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget] and [JRA-59892|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59892] for details
fields.summary: As an Administrator I want check if JIRA is able to connect to BaseURL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60561].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If you disassociate an issue security scheme from a project and then delete it, it doesn't actually remove that issue security level from the issue, which renders the issue inaccessible.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue security scheme and level
# Associate that issue security scheme with a project and associate the issue security level with an issue.
# Disassociate the issue security scheme from the project, you'll be told that the security level will be removed from x issues. Nothing actually happens if you check the DB.
# Delete the security scheme
# Browse to the issue in step 2.

h3. Expected Results

Issue has no security level and anyone can see it.

h3. Actual Results

Issue can not be viewed by anyone.
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the issue security link to un-existing issue security levels
{noformat}
update jiraissue set security = null where security in (select distinct security from jiraissue where security not in (select id from schemeissuesecuritylevels ) and security is not null);
{noformat}
fields.summary: Deleting an issue security scheme does not remove it from issues and renders them inaccessible
Provide Steps on how to add additional logging levels for unlisted packages

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a page on Confluence contains a special character on the page title it cannot be linked to a JIRA issue. (e.g. comma, asterisk, colon, parenthesis, etc.)

h3. Environment
Affected Confluence: 6.0.0-OD-2015.50.1-0003

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on Confluence using the *:*;
# Go to JIRA and open an issue;
# Go to More > Link > Confluence Page
# Past the Confluence URL.

h3. Expected Results
Link the page.

h3. Actual Results
Error: {{No confluence page found with the given URL}}
LOG:
{code}
2015-12-11 11:36:48.486963500 2015-12-11 11:36:48,485 WARN [http-bio-1990-exec-1113] [auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator] authenticate Failed to login trusted application [wdtablesystems.atlassian.net] due to bad URL signature. Received protocol version [2]. Required protocol version [2]
2015-12-11 11:36:48.486965500  -- traceId: ef3e1376ecb62305
{code}

h3.Workaround
# Remove the *:* from the page title.
# Alternative workaround: Link the page by pageID instead, (e.g. {{CONFLUENCEURL}}/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=########)
 (The pageID can be found by mousing-over the edit button on the page and is seen on the bottom of your browser.
fields.summary: Pages with special character on the title cannot be linked with issues on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60546].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Tomcat has no automatic way of reporting if there's long running / stuck threads. When troubleshooting performance it can be a lot harder to know what's going on without generating thread dumps. We'd like to automatically get some more information about this.

h3. Suggested Solution

Adding this parameter to the server.xml will log stuck threads in the catalina.out:
{code}<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve" threshold="120" />
{code}

This will log any request thread (eg http thread) that has been processing for more than 120 seconds. This will not log background threads, eg scheduled jobs or any long running operation that processes in the background, like import/export, reindex etc.
If you are expecting to see something in these logs that you do not, that does not mean it is not running for more than 60s. It likely just means it is not running in a request thread. Thread dumps over time are still the best way to diagnose long running threads.

h3. Workaround

Manually add StuckThreadDetectionValve to JIRA_INSTALL/conf/server.xml
* This must be done on each node if using JIRA Data Center

Add the following line to the server.xml file. Add this line BEFORE the </Engine> tag located near the end of the file. 

{noformat}
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve" threshold="120" />
{noformat}

EXAMPLE:
* Notice the StuckThreadDetectionValve was added before </Engine> and after the "/>" on the prior line
{noformat}
            <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve"
                   pattern="%a %{jira.request.id}r %{jira.request.username}r %t "%m %U%q %H" %s %b %D "%{Referer}i" "%{User-Agent}i" "%{jira.request.assession.id}r""/>
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve" threshold="120" />
        </Engine>
    </Service>
</Server>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Ship Tomcat's long running (stuck) thread logging by default

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60538].
  {panel}

We are using JIRA 6.4.12 
System groups like jira-users, confluence-users, stash-users  are available for all users as they are the member in these System groups.
Currently a user in "Project Administrator" role is able to search and add these system groups (available in JIRA application) in his project. But the project should be added project related groups but not the system specific groups .
This is a security risk as the "Project Administrator" in JIRA can add accidentally any other system specific groups and all other members in system specific groups (who do not require the access in the project) can also get access in the project.
So the project administrators should not add system groups in their projects and there should be admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen.
Please implement the solution as this is a security issue.
fields.summary: JIRA should have admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60537].
  {panel}

When executing irreversible actions (e.g. removing issue filters), JIRA should log them as the records with the default log level.

Background of this feature request, our customer accidentally removed their issue filter and it would be better that we could easily know which filter was removed.
(FYI. Finally, we could find the filter from their database.)

Aside from this case, irreversible actions accidentally might lead to severe problems.
Logging such actions would be a good way to prove what was done by the users.

Regards,
Yuki
fields.summary: When executing irreversible action JIRA should log them as the records

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60532].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The {{DefaultUserPickerSearchService}} builds a query that is very slow to run on instances with many users. It seems to run faster for searches on short usernames compared to searches on long usernames (e.g. a search for "b" runs much faster than a search for "bhas").

This causes features such as mentions to perform poorly on instances with many users (e.g. JAC).

h3. Environment

This performance problem is more evident on instances with many users, such as JAC. For local testing, you can use the JIRA Data Generator Plugin to create many users (about 50,000 is necessary to start seeing a significant problem).

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Hit an endpoint which uses the user search service e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/user/viewissue/search?username=bhas&issueKey=JRA-59658

h3. Expected result

Response comes back in less than 100ms.

h3. Actual result

Response comes back in ~2.5s

h3. Notes

{{DefaultUserPickerSearchService}} ends up creating the following query:

{code}SELECT ID, directory_id, user_name, lower_user_name, active, created_date, updated_date, first_name, lower_first_name, last_name, lower_last_name, display_name, lower_display_name, email_address, lower_email_address, CREDENTIAL, deleted_externally, EXTERNAL_ID FROM PUBLIC.cwd_user WHERE (((lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? )) AND (active =  ? )) AND (directory_id =  ? ) ORDER BY lower_user_name LIMIT 100{code}

Where each LIKE is prepending a separator to the search query e.g. if you search for "Broo" it will create a LIKE for: " Broo", "-Broo", "(Broo" etc. This is so a search for "Broo" will return a user like "Mike Cannon-Brookes". The query above can be even worse if the search is also including results for users whose email address matches, as it will add another 8 LIKE clauses to the above query.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Slow query in user picker : DefaultUserPickerSearchService

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After clearing the value of *Complete Date/Time Format* from *Look and Feel* page, we can't move to any admin page.
Additionally, we can't also revert the setting because we can't move to *Look and Feel* page again.

h3. Environment

Server OS : Windows 7, Windows Server 2012 R2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to *Look and Feel* page
# Clear the value of *Complete Date/Time Format*

h3. Expected Results

If JIRA doesn't allow users to clear the value, the UI should inhibit them from clearing the value.

h3. Actual Results

We couldn't move to all admin pages.
 
h3.Workaround

We can revert the setting with a REST API.
If you use curl command, please execute as follows.

{noformat}
$ curl http://<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<BASE_URL>/rest/api/latest/application-properties/jira.lf.date.complete -X PUT -H 'Content-type: application/json' -d '{"id":"jira.lf.date.complete","value":"dd/MMM/yy h:mm a"}'
{noformat}

(i) Please replace <USERNAME>, <PASSWORD> and <BASE_URL> with admin user's credentials and your instance's base url.
fields.summary: After clearing the value of "Complete Date/Time Format" from "Look and Feel" page, we can't move to any admin page
Gadgets server-to-server connectivity errors are swallowed, we should log them instead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60529].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently if you link two JIRA Instances or any applications in the atlassian suite. There isn't a way to completely disable the activity stream from the linked instances. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow more granularity to completely disable the activity stream of application linked instances. i.e. If you link to jira.atlassian.com which will allow you remote issue link but you don't want/need the activity stream to display in your origin instance.
fields.summary: Disable Activity stream from application linked instances.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60528].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a Project Admin who does not have JIRA Administrator Global Permissions attempts to change the Default Assignee for their Project, it generates an error stating:
{noformat}You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the project key.{noformat}
!ChangeDefaultAssignee.png|thumbnail!

Per [Defining a Project - A note about Project Administrators|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/defining-a-project-776636280.html#Definingaproject-projectadminnoteAnoteaboutprojectadministrators], Project Admins do not have the ability to change the Default Assignee. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the option to change the Default Assignee for Project Admin only users
or, 
Display a useful message indicating that the Project Admin cannot change the Default Assignee because they lack JIRA Administrator Global Permissions. 
Ex:{noformat}You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the default assignee.{noformat}

h3. Workaround 
If you add the user to the {{administrators}} group, they will be able to edit the Project Lead. Or if that is not possible, another project administrator in the {{administrators}} group can make the change.
fields.summary: Display a Better Error Message when a Project Admin Attempts to Change the Default Assignee

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60527].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
{quote}If you're using JIRA and JIRA Agile, and you want to upgrade to the latest version of JIRA Software, you must upgrade to JIRA Software 7.0 first.{quote}
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.1.x+upgrade+notes

This isn't completely true - you can upgrade directly as long as you have JIRA Agile 6.4 or above. 

Similarly aren't any upgrade notes for JIRA 7.0 specifying version numbers:
v5.2 onwards can go straight to 7.0
4.4.5 to 5.1 then you will need to upgrade to JIRA 6.4 then 7
4.4.5 and earlier - need to go to 4.4.5 then 6.4 then 7
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Change the upgrade notes to specify that this specifically applies to JIRA Agile v6.6.80 or below.
fields.summary: JIRA 7.1 release notes are confusing

h3.*Issue Summary*

When a user has JIRA behind an SSO such as SAFE and sets up an issue collector to have non JIRA users raise issues, the issue collector appears broken showing only Name and Email fields.

This issue occurs if they do not have any active sessions and have cleared their browser cache.

h3. *Steps to Replicate*
# Set up JIRA to be authenticated into via SAFE SSO.
# Create an issue collector in any project.
# Create a page that calls the issue collector for raising tickets.

h3. *Expected Behavior*
When a user presses the Issue collector trigger they should see the configured form always.

h3. *Actual Behavior*
Users get the issue collector but it only shows the name and email fields mostly if there is no active sessions in JIRA on the same browser the issue collector was opened from.
fields.summary: Issue Collector not rendering correctly When JIRA is behind an SSO

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60518].
  {panel}

We need to transfer the issue status to the external system, so we've made up the workflow with the "trigger a webhook postfubction". The webhook should only work with transitions, so no issue events are selected. 

It works unstable - sometimes webhook fires immediately after the transition and all the reauired info is posted in the external system.
Sometimes it works with the time delay (various time intervals).
Sometimes it doesnt fire at all.

It is only logged when the webhook was sent successfuly. 
We've tried all the options from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41388, but all connections are ok.

Are there any other suggestions of the possible reason of the problem?
fields.summary: WebHooks not firing when the event triggered is Workflow post function

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When sending out an outgoing mail triggered by user mentions, the "Reply-to:" Header breaks down the name if the email has a name in it. For example, if the user has configured the From address in the SMTP Mail Server settings as "Atlassian Support Test <test@atlassian.com>", when the email is sent out it becomes "Atlassian, Support, Test, test@atlassian.com". This will lead to errors when replying.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.11 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a new SMTP Mail Server
# In the From Address field, input "Atlassian Support Test <your email address>".
# Create a new issue.
# Mention a user for the first time in the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The mentioned user would get an Email triggered by the notification with the reply-to header being "Atlassian Support Test <your email address>".

h3. Actual Results
The reply-to header will instead be "Atlassian, Support, Test <your email address>".
 
h3.Workaround
It is recommended not to put any names in the From Address field in the SMTP settings, instead just input the email address only.
fields.summary: Outgoing Mails triggered by User Mentions have a broken reply-to Header if it contains a name.

*Problem Definition*

At the moment, JIRA provides the ability to filter audit log information. But, when it comes to exporting the audit log information, it will export all the available information regardless of the specified filter 

*Suggested Solution*

Having the ability to export the audit log information based on the result returned by the filter
fields.summary: Ability to export Audit Log data based on the returned result from the filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60508].
  {panel}

h3. *Issue summary*

When a user accesses JIRA and while logging in selects the option to remember me, even if the user access JIRA everyday, the last login date fails to be updated and would refer to the day the user logged in and selected the remember me option.

This is expected begavior based on how this function is designed however, should the user need to disable users that have not logged in in a while or for taking reports of similar scenario, they would not be able to because the last date shown even in the database table is the day (s)he checked the option and logged in. Date only updated if user clears browser cache, logs in from a different browser, signs out of JIRA or deletes the login token.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Open JIRA.
 # Enter credentials, select the remember me option and login.
 # Close the tab.
 # Open a new tab and access JIRA again.

h3. *Expected Behavior*

JIRA would launch and when it logs in using the token stored it would update the last login data in the database.
h3. *Actual Result*

JIRA would login however, the last login data is not updated due to the remember me token taking effect and making JIRA assume user never logged out.
fields.summary: Wrong Last login date because of remember me option checked

h3. Summary
Adding a Pie Chart gadget to your JIRA dashboard gives an error when the *Statistic Type* is set to the Tempo Account field and issues included in the chart have 'None' as the value for the Account field. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core Cloud
* Tempo Timesheets

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create some issues in the project and ensure that the 'Accounts' field has the value 'None' for a few of the issues.
# Create a filter for all issues in the project 
!original issue filter.png|thumbnail!

# Select 'Pie Chart' from the list
# Select 'Edit' and change the Statistic Type to *Account* and click the 'Save' button
# The preview is displayed  
!preview.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on 'Save to Dashboard' and select a dashboard 

h3. Expected Results
The pie chart displays on the dashboard as it did in the 'charts' preview.
(this works for other field types with 'None' values)

The gadget on the dashboard displays an error message

Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above.

fields.description:
*Experienced Behavior:*

Pasting mixed content into JIRA behaves differently depending on browser used and where content is pasted into

*Expected Behavior:*

Consistent behavior between browsers

*Steps to Reproduce:* 
# Copy mixed content to clipboard
#* When testing content from Microsoft Outlook and Word were used
# Using Internet Explorer 11, paste content into comment box that appears on view issue screen. The add screenshot popup appears
# Paste same content into comment box using Firefox or Chrome. Only the text is pasted. 
# In IE, edit issue and paste content into the description or comment fields. Notice that the text and attachment have been added. 
# In Firefox/Chrome, edit issue and paste content into the description or comment fields. Notice only the text is added.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior between browsers when pasting mixed content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60497].
  {panel}

The sample dbconfig.xml on https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/connecting-jira-to-sql-server-2012-610763188.html includes   {{<pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>}}.

We say this should be set to false on https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/tuning-database-connections-288657160.html

Other version specific docs do not include this:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2008-802592183.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-802592179.html
fields.summary: pool-test-on-borrow set to false consistently across database docs
User Stories in status "In progress" automatically
Enhancing Reporting functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60494].
  {panel}

When time tracking is enabled the following fields are automatically added:

- Original Estimation
- Remaining Estimate
- Time Spent

A user cannot choose which of these fields they want to display. Being able to display specific time tracking fields would help customers in their workflow.
fields.summary: Allow for fine tuning of time tracking fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60491].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When editing tickets within JIRA, screen readers e.g., JAWS are unable to read the page correctly.
h3. Environment

JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-023
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Open an existing ticket
Click the Edit button
h3. Expected Results

JAWS should be able to render the entire page including the modal
h3. Actual Results

JAWS is only able to render the page title
h3. Notes

Looking at the page code, when clicking the Edit button, there is a JavaScript event firing that applies a hidden tag to the page. It appears this was done to confine focus to the modal window. It appears however that the modal window is hidden from view as well. Removing the ARIA tag, which is hidden, from the page DIV, it should fix the issue.
h3. Workaround

No known work around for this
fields.summary: Screen readers unable to read EDIT modal in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* If a page in Confluence is created with a expand macro that has a JIRA issue link, every time the page is updated, it will spam an irrelevant entry in the History tab of the JIRA issue
 !image-2016-04-06-22-26-36-556.png|thumbnail! 
*  If a Confluence page is updated frequently which is often the case in creative settings the update, regardless if meaningful or not, will create an entry in the linked JIRA issue history.
* This leads to hundreds of entries in some issues and hence makes the activity panel unreadable. 
* As Administrator we need to be able to keep the issue history useful for the teams so they can quickly identify relevant information in it.

h3. Environment
* JIRA & Confluence linked using application link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Application Link JIRA and Confluence 
# Create an Issue in JIRA
# Create a page in Confluence 
# Add an Expand Macro and insert a JIRA issue link in that Expand Macro 
 !image-2016-04-06-22-29-22-557.png|thumbnail! 
# Save the page
# Monitor the Issue History tab of the JIRA issue that is in that Expand Macro
# Try to edit the Confluence page ( add something random on the page )  and then Monitor the Issue History tab of the JIRA issue again.

h3. Expected Results
# The JIRA Issue history should not spam irrelevant entries 
 
h3. Actual Results
The JIRA Issue history is spammed everytime an edit is done in Confluence
 !image-2016-04-06-22-26-36-556.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This bug is not reproducible if the *Expand Macro is not used* 

This bug can be reproduced from the following macros as well:
* Pivot Table macro 
* Note macro 
* Deck of cards macro
fields.summary: Expand Macro with JIRA issue spams the JIRA issue History.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Description
There is no easy way of removing some of the avatars that come pre-shipped with JIRA, so that they are not available to users, although it is possible to add new custom avatars to the list.   In cases where the business nature of certain organisation considers some of the avatars to be inappropriate there is no way to remove those specific avatars from the admin area.

h3. Suggestion
Provide a way to manage what avatars are available to users in admin area.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin I'd like to be able to restrict use of some of the default user avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60488].
  {panel}

The only reference for Custom Field contexts in our official documentation is:
{quote}
h3. Adding a new context

Adding a new context allows you to configure a custom field differently for different combinations of issue types and projects.

*To add a new context:*
# Navigate to the Custom Fields page, locate the desired custom field and choose cog icon > Configure.
# Click the Add new context link. The 'Add configuration scheme context' page will be displayed (see below).
#* Under 'Add configuration scheme context', enter a 'Label' and 'Description' for your new context — these are used for administrative purposes only and will not be shown to your end-users.
#* Under 'Choose applicable issue types', select the issue type(s) to which you want this Default Value and Options to apply. You can select Any issue types if you wish.
#* Under 'Choose applicable contexts', select the project(s) to which you want this Default Value and Options to apply. Note that this will apply to only issues with the selected issue type(s) as above.

A custom field can only have one context per JIRA project. So you cannot have multiple contexts for different issue types in the same project.
{quote}
Source: [Configuring a Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+a+Custom+Field]

This leaves room for a lot of questions on how contexts work and what happens after a new context is created for an existing field (e.g. when there are existing issues with populated values).

We need to clarify that even if the options from the Default Configuration are the same as the ones used in a context, once a context is created, the old values will be rendered obsolete / read only.

Related bugs and docs:
* [JRA-33026|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33026] - Additional configuration context caused missing value for field with optionid
* [Change Context for an Existing Custom Field Without Losing Old Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Change+Context+for+an+Existing+Custom+Field+Without+Losing+Old+Data]
fields.summary: Improve Documentation on Custom Field Contexts

h4. Problem
Some of our customers ask if it is possible to run a single-node instance with a Data Center license (for Bitbucket, JIRA and Confluence). It may not be trivial, but the answer is yes, you simply [install Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/installing-jira-data-center-604274940.html] and skip the steps of adding additional nodes to the cluster.

h4. Request
Please mention this question and the answer in the related FAQs so that this information is publicly accessible, saving time for support and advocates.

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-faqs-666602256.html
fields.summary: Documentation request: Single node data center FAQ

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60483].
  {panel}

*Summary*
Recently the "create linked issue" from the "More" menu under an existing JIRA issue has become available.
The fields displayed on this screen appear to be fixed, and can not get edited using any of the existing screen configurations.
We would like to be able to edit this screen in similar fashion as is possible with the create/edit/view issue screens

*Workaround*
In order for a field to show up, you will need to first add it to the create issue screen relevant to the project.
Then, in the field configuration, the field in question has to be configured to be a "Required" field.
Following these instructions will make the field in question show up in the create linked issue screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60473].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Adding only content occurring before a specified marker or separator in the email body while the rest of the email body is ignored, is only available for Mail Handlers meant for creating comments in JIRA. For use-cases where there is need to achieve the same for mail handlers meant to create new issues, JIRA doesn't provide an out of the box way to strip content occurring after a designated marker e.g. a regex pattern, excepted for quoted content.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a Issue Creation mail handler that can be configured to strip not just quoted email body, but content occurring after a designated marker or seperator as well.

h3. Notes
The simplest use-case or scenario where this would be relevant is if you would like to always strip out the email signatures from emails.
fields.summary: Add an issue from content before a specified marker or separator in the email body
